content:
ApplicationUpgradeState ApplicationUpgradeState Enum

Definition

Namespace:
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

Enumerates the state of the application upgrade.

Edit

In this Article

public enum ApplicationUpgradeStatePublic Enum ApplicationUpgradeState

Fields

Failed Failed

Indicates that the upgrade has failed.
Invalid Invalid

Indicates that the type is not valid. All Service Fabric enumerations have an invalid type.
RollingBackCompleted RollingBackCompleted

Indicates that the roll back of the upgrade is completed. The completed rollback indicates that upgrade to the target version has failed.
RollingBackInProgress RollingBackInProgress

Indicates that the upgrade is in the process of rolling back. This indicates that upgrade to the target version has failed. Note that this state can also be observed temporarily if the upgrade is interrupted to start a new upgrade.
RollingForwardCompleted RollingForwardCompleted

Indicates that the upgrade to the target application type version is completed.
RollingForwardInProgress RollingForwardInProgress

Indicates that the upgrade to the target application type version is in progress.
RollingForwardPending RollingForwardPending

Indicates that the upgrade to the target application type version is pending user input. The MoveNextApplicationUpgradeDomainAsync(ApplicationUpgradeProgress) is used to move the upgrade forward.
